duties_responsibilities.duty: Focus on plant EHS initiatives and rollout safety policies
Lead incident investigations and root cause analysis
Perform risk and hazard assessments/inspections and suggest/drive actions to mitigate/reduce them
Ensure compliance with safety and environmental policies and programs
Facilitate safety, health, and environmental training for all plant personnel
Support plant initiatives towards Lean, Kaizen, Cost Reduction, and other facility improvements

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Safety and Health, Environmental or equivalent degree (Master’s preferred)
Prior Safety Specific Training (OSHA 30 Hour, Certificate in Occupational Safety & Health, etc.)
Professional Certifications in Safety, Environmental or Occupational Health (e.g. CSP, CIH, OHST, SMS, CEM, CHMM, etc.)
Working knowledge of federal safety and environmental laws (e.g. OSHA, EPA, etc.)
